Description: Rim fragment of North Ionian pottery hemispherical cup (bird bowl); interior glazed with added red band lined in white; exterior: black band at rim and lower body black; in reserved handle zone bird in outline with a cross-hatched body, facing right to remains of circular object.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The suggestion by Kirschner that Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, 9473 may be from the same vase seems unlikely, though it is of the same type. Further bibliography: Posamentir – Solovyov 2007, 184 Abb. 1a, 2–3; Kerschner in Akurgal et al. 2002, 63–72; Kerschner 2001, 79–80; Möller 2000, 141–142; 255 Nr. 1–17; Kerschner 1995, 175–181 esp.. 175 Nr. 8; Venit 1988, 129 Nr. 1 Pl. 1,1 (= Kerschner 2001, Pl. 7,2); Coldstream 1968, 277–279; 298–301 Nr. 35.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 228, no. 138)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 115, pl. XXXVI, no. 327.1)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 77-8, Nau 8, pl. 2e-f)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.074)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
